result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross Bolingbroke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $1500 bail applied, paid in full. Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Submit DNA.
Agend must know all Dr's def is seeing and aware of any prescriptions def is taking.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

count 2
count 1

Exhibit 1 - CD squad video located in CD/DVD Exhibit binder
Exhibits located in Exhibit room FC 1-3

8:44am Defendant Ross  Bolingbroke in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alme Boaz informs court of newer jury instruction case law regarding identification. Court and State will review during recess. Statements as to video sound by Attorney Gerol. Response by Attorney Alme-Boaz. 8:52am Jurors called to courtroom. 20 jurors called to box. 9:01am Voir dire by Court. 9:07am Voir dire by DA Gerol. 9:17am Voir dire by Attorney Alme-Boaz. 9:35am 12 jurors called, remaining jurors thanked and excused. Panel sworn. 9:38am Jury excused from courtroom. 9:40am Recess. 9:54am Case recalled, appearances same. Attorney Alme-Boaz address' sequestration and motion in limine. Response by State. Court orders sequestration. Court rules on motions. 10:02am Jury returns to courtroom. Preliminary instructions by Court. 10:09am Opening statement by DA Gerol. 10:18am Opening statement by Attorney Alme-Boaz. 10:30am State calls Deputy Kyle Collins sworn and testified. 10:40am Cross examination.  10:44am State calls Trooper Michael Dyer sworn and testified. 10:56am Cross examination.  11:00am State calls Corporal Patrick Frame sworn and testified. 11:18am Cross examination. 11:29am Jury excused from courtroom. Attorney Alme-Boaz 'offer of proof' regarding identification and county policy. 11:46am Jury returns to courtroom. Cross examination continues.  12:00pm Redirect. 12:09pm Jury excused for lunch. 12:15pm Recess. 1:22pm In session, appearances same, jury returns to courtroom. Recross. Video played. Recross continues of witness. 1:40pm Redirect.  1:42pm State calls witness S.W. sworn and testified. 1:45pm No cross. State calls Sgt Andrew Mroz sworn and testified. 1:55pm Cross examination. 2:00pm Witness excused. State plays video. 2:32pm Video complete. State rests. Jury excused from courtroom. Attorney Alme-Boaz requests instruction to be added to final instructions.  2:38pm Recess. 2:55pm In session, appearances same. Jury instruction conference. 3:29pm Jury returns to courtroom. Defense recalls Deputy Frame. Cross examination. 3:35pm Jury excused. Final instruction conference. 3:39pm Jury returns to courtroom. Court instructs jury panel. 3:55pm Closing argument by DA Gerol. 4:12pm Closing argument by Attorney Alme-Boaz. 4:28pm Rebuttal by DA Gerol. 4:39pm Final jury instruction. 4:50pm Jury excused to deliberate. 6:00 pm Court is informed a verdict has been reached. 6:09 pm All parties in court - Verdict read: Ct. 1 - Guilty / Ct. 2 - Guilty. 6:10 pm Jury polled, thanked and excused. Defense motion not withstanding the verdict denied. Court grants State's motion for judgment on the verdict. Atty. Alme Boaz requests a separate sentencing date. Court revokes defendant's bail and remands him to the custody of the Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept.
